pr_title: Feature: Add ability for game client to download map listing from maps server

timeline.bodyText: This method is moved to a dedicated class.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText:
The 'all args constructor' in this class is replaced by annotation.
The construction mechanism and overall this class was simplified and refactored.
There is a utility constructor that omits the 'image' parameter. That was removed by simplifying updating clients to use the all arg constructor, which in turn use the constructor defined by the lombok parameter. We then add a conversion constructor to go from a 'MapFileDownloadListing' to a 'DownloadListing'.
Of note, we introduce a new class 'MapFileDownloadListing' so that we can transmit pure strings (no enums and no Version object) over network. This gives us more flexibility for compatibility, hence the need for a conversion constructor.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: These 'from' methods are used by conversion constructor. Of note we create a 'default' case to map to an enum value to give us flexibiity in case we change this going in the forward and then old clients do not have the new values. In this case the new clients will use the default value.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: Would you mind adding this information to the javadoc?
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
I'm a little torn on this. On one hand it's good information. On the other we two things:

It should probably be convention for us to never use Enum.valueOf. It's gotten us into trouble before and it's kinda notorious if you add new elements and then have 'old' clients, it then causes errors. Hence, we should always be defaulting or allowing enum string representations to be empty. Any straight usages of "Enum.valueOf" for enums that have any possibility to change is a potential problem.
The visibility is class protected, could be private

Would it be agreeable to add a note about this to our developer documentation? Such comments should apply to all enums, hence I'm hesitant to add the same boilerplate comment to each.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: Method visibility lowered to private in: 4b75d4c
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: Hmm I mainly wanted to suggest documenting that the method returns "MAP" for unknown values instead of throwing an exception, not sure if this sort of API docuentation makes sense for private methods, but I still think it would be nice nevertheless
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure if it'd really just be faster to read the method to see it does not throw.
FWIW, this method is updated soon and eventually goes away completely in a future revision.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: All clients that used this constructor now use the all-args constructor directly.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: this constructor is replaced by lombok
timeline.author: DanVanAtta
DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: This is the new conversion constructor, the main update to this class.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: This is a bit of a fix. If we get an empty list and no other error, then clicking the 'download maps' button does nothing. Removing this filter at least has the button doing something, albeit we show an empty download maps window, but at least that is something.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: This 'if' statement is new and is logic to grab the map download listing from server (behind beta flag). The 'else' block is existing logic that is executed if the beta flag is not turned on (default)
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText:
This class is all new. Instead of creating client setting override settings that can get very tricky and involves radio buttons, instead we have a props file where we add values, comment them out, and then can uncomment them to activate them. I was looking at replicating the lobby server override setting and it would have been complex to replicate that for another server.
Though, having a client setting config to allow all users switch between production and prerelease is still useful, so we want to be sure we keep in mind non-dev's that are testing our software and that they are given the proper override controls. For now and for maps server this seemed like the most easy & direct way to get overrides.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: So just to get this straight: The "regular user" will not see another entry in client settings, correct?
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
FWIW, being able to build an override mechanism was almost a compelling reason to merge the two servers together. This is an area where we see potential scaling problems.
Putting that to the side, we will need a way for 'regular users', and really us, to be able to select between a prerelease and prod server. That could be as simple as a radio button, a free-form text field perhaps could do too. It might be feasible to have the override file available as part of the distribution, essentially a properties file. I think the latter might be best so we can keep the coding a bit simpler. The current fields to override the lobby server are pretty involved, making that generic would be doable but I think would be very complex.
So, in short, regular users will probably not see a setting to override the maps server, either it might be a simple radio button or a config file that can be modified. TBD exactly which though, in part "we'll see soon".
Does that clear up your question? Let me know if it quite doesn't or if you have follow-on questions I could help with.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.message:
Add ability for game client to download map listing from maps server

- Refactor: move 'fetch maps' functionality from ClientContext to a dedicated class
  'MapListingFetcher'
- Add map server URI to servers listing
- Adds a new map server URI override mechanism with a 'dev-overrides.properties' file.
  Uncommenting properties in that file will have them take effect and override config.
  This is a simpler way to inject overrides compared to using ClientSettings. We have
  such a mechanism for lobby server and likely that will be migrated as it's simpler.
  Of note, the dev-overrides.properties file is not required and we do not expect
  it to be present when the game is distributed.
- Adds an HTTP client to fetch map listing from the maps server
- Adds a 'beta' switch to use the maps server for map listing download. If the switch
  is set then we use the maps server. In this case we'll use the new http client
  to download the map listing from the maps server.
- Fixes download map listing logic where the download maps window is not rendered
  if the map download list. In such cases, the map download button would appear
  to do nothing to the user, so better to show a download map window with
  nothing available, at least it is something.

  'MapListingFetcher'
- Add map server URI to servers listing
- Adds a new map server URI override mechanism with a 'dev-overrides.properties' file.
  Uncommenting properties in that file will have them take effect and override config.
  This is a simpler way to inject overrides compared to using ClientSettings. We have
  such a mechanism for lobby server and likely that will be migrated as it's simpler.
  Of note, the dev-overrides.properties file is not required and we do not expect
  it to be present when the game is distributed.

- Adds a 'beta' switch to use the maps server for map listing download. If the switch
  is set then we use the maps server. In this case we'll use the new http client
  to download the map listing from the maps server.
- Fixes download map listing logic where the download maps window is not rendered
  if the map download list. In such cases, the map download button would appear
  to do nothing to the user, so better to show a download map window with
  nothing available, at least it is something.

timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
We could upper-case the parameter to make that case insensitive.
As-is, I don't think there are too many if/else cases, it's quite tame. I think moving away from an enum is very possible here as the client probably should not be so aware of all of the categories.
The suggestion is not unreasonable, I had considered that. I don't like the fact though that the exception is ignored and we have a return statement from the catch block (feels a lot like control-flow-by-exception-handling).
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder how well this out-of-date mechanism can be improved.
Maybe calculating the hash sum of the zip and double check with the server that caches the hash values?
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: My plan is to keep using version numbers but remove the auto-incrementing version number from map-maker visibility, have it be auto-managed, and make map uploads be immutable. I think there will be a place for hashes to ensure integrity of a map, for checking identity though I think that might be too costly (and perhaps hard to organize on the file system)
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: Any strong reason for buffered reader over just an input stream?
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: Updated this to use Files.newInputStream and ensured that the input stream was closed: a9f60b9
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
AFAIK BufferedInputStream or BufferedReader which uses the former internally, is more efficient.
Other than that there shouldn't be a huge difference.
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: Is it more efficient because you can read back in the stream? Barring any compelling reason otherwise I'm thinking to keep it simple here.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: First answer to this SO gets into this topic:  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3122422/usage-of-bufferedinputstream
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: If you decide not to use java.nio here, this FileInputStream should be closed after this regardless
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: Thanks for spotting that, fixed in: a9f60b9
replies.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.message: Reduce method visibility from package default to private.
Ensure file input stream is closed when reading dev overrride properties file.
